posts.name: Yohay Maccabi
posts.cooked:
Hi, Our  team is in search of a reliable yet budget-friendly battery charger. We’re looking for recommendations based on your experiences. If you have any helpful tips, please share!

Yohay Maccabi, Team Captain TRIGON 5990.

posts.name: Travis Norris
posts.cooked:
AndyMark recently started selling this NOCO Genius charger which comes in 1 or 3 battery options. The same models may be available from local sellers as well.

Here’s a thread about some of their testing details if you’re interested.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee

posts.custom_user_title: Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee

posts.name: Yohay Maccabi
posts.cooked: Hi I saw this product. It cost 244$ + 81$ shipping to Israel, and we’re searching for a cheaper deal. (we all ready have one, we just want to charge more batteries simultaneously)

posts.name: Rich Jr
posts.cooked:
Do you have the parts and tools to put your own SB50/SB120 connectors on? — If you don’t the AM one unfortunately might be your best deal. — If you do then your best bet might be to search local suppliers for NOCO genius chargers and put your own ends on them.

What’s your budget?

How many additional batteries are you looking to charge?

Other brands/models to look for locally would be:

RealPro/DualPro: https://www.amazon.com/Dual-Recreation-Triple-Output-Charger/dp/B001RN4AXC

BatteryTender: (this model is only 3amp but you are allowed up to 6amp) https://www.amazon.com/Deltran-Battery-Tender-Power-Plus/dp/B016S7NHWQ

Edit: Rules to keep in mind on your search, according to the 2023 rules: image 1674×223 38.5 KB

image 1674×223 38.5 KB

image 1674×223 38.5 KB

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271

posts.custom_user_title: FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271

posts.name: Yohay Maccabi
posts.cooked:
We use a SB50 connector, but it’s not possible to put a SB120 connector on wire that isn’t a 4 awg cable. If there is a way to connect a SB120 connector to other awg cables with an adapter I would like to know.

Our budget is about 190$, maybe a bit more .

5/6 batteries simultaneously.

The battery charger we have now is the one of “Dual Electronics”.

posts.name: Rich Jr
posts.cooked:
yohay:

We use a SB50 connector, but it’s not possible to put a SB120 connector on wire that isn’t a 4 awg cable. If there is a way to connect a SB120 connector to other awg cables with an adapter I would like to know.

If you use SB50 then I would stick with that as it’s the most common connector across FRC , I only mentioned SB120 just incase you were using it.

yohay:

Our budget is about 190$, maybe a bit more .

5/6 batteries simultaneously.

The battery charger we have now is the one of “Dual Electronics”.

Unfortunately I don’t have a solution that’s going to meet all of these needs/get you closer without wasting a ton of money on shipping, I would save some money up until you can afford the triple charger from AM

I would see if there are other teams in your area that might have old chargers from the KOP they aren’t using any more.
